official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of Transportation to establish a program to provide grants to carry out
			 projects to reduce railway noise levels that adversely impact schools
			 located in urbanized areas, and for other purposes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall enter into an agreement with the National Academy of Sciences
			 to conduct a study on railway noise in the United States.

text.#text: The
In conducting the study, the National Academy of Sciences shall examine—
the threshold of railway noise at which health begins to be affected;
the effectiveness of noise abatement programs for railway noise on the property of a school;
the impacts of railway noise on schools; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and whether such practices
			 fairly and accurately reflect the burden of noise on communities.

text.#text: Not later than 12 months after the date of submission of the report under
establish a single system of measuring railway noise that—

has a highly reliable relationship between projected railway noise exposure and surveyed reactions
			 of individuals to noise; and
is applied uniformly in measuring railway noise near urbanized areas;

establish a single system for determining the exposure of individuals to railway noise in urbanized
			 areas, including noise intensity, duration, frequency, and time of
			 occurrence; and

, determine minimum standards for
			 railway noise levels on the property of a school located in an urbanized

text.#text:
If a change in the rail operations of a rail operator described in subsection (a) establishes a
			 substantial new nonconforming noise level on the property of a school
			 located in an urbanized area, or significantly reduces nonconforming noise
			 levels on the property of such a school, that is not reflected in the
			 noise exposure map, the rail operator shall submit a revised noise
			 exposure map to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may submit a noise
			 compatibility program to the
after—

text.#text: A rail operator that submitted a noise exposure map under
consulting with public agencies and planning authorities in the area covered by the map; and
notice and an opportunity for a public hearing.

A program submitted under subsection (a) shall state the measures the rail operator has taken or
			 proposes to take to reduce existing nonconforming noise levels on the
			 property of a school and prevent creating additional nonconforming noise
			 levels in the area covered by the map. The measures may include
			 constructing barriers or acoustical shielding and soundproofing of schools
			 subject to a nonconforming noise level.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall approve or disapprove a program submitted under subsection (a) of this section
			 not later than 180 days after receiving it. The

shall approve
			 the program if the program—

to carry

			 program to carry out the program directly or in cooperation with—

text.#text: The
a local educational agency of a school that is subject to nonconforming noise levels; or
a unit of local government in the area surrounding the school that has nonconforming noise levels.

The Federal share of a project for which a grant is made under subsection (d) is 80 percent of the
			 cost of the project.
